function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Implicit assumption that supply chains are not affected by major disruptions like COVID-19","Impact":"Increased vulnerability to major disruptions, leading to supply chain breakdowns and economic losses","Mitigation":"Revision of assumptions to incorporate the possibility of major disruptions, contingency planning, and diversification of suppliers and transportation methods","Technologies":"Predictive analytics, supply chain management software, real-time monitoring tools","People":"Supply chain managers, logistics professionals, business owners","Owner":"Supply chain management professionals, business executives"},{"Description":"Lack of consideration for social and environmental issues in supply chain performance","Impact":"Risk of negative social and environmental impacts, leading to reputational damage and legal consequences","Mitigation":"Integration of social and environmental metrics into performance evaluation, supplier selection based on ethical and sustainable practices, stakeholder engagement","Technologies":"Sustainability assessment tools, supply chain transparency platforms, stakeholder management software","People":"Sustainability managers, environmental consultants, supply chain auditors","Owner":"Sustainability departments, corporate governance bodies"},{"Description":"Inadequate focus on technology adoption and knowledge creation in supply chain management","Impact":"Missed opportunities for efficiency improvement and innovation, resulting in competitive disadvantage","Mitigation":"Investment in technology training, collaboration with tech experts, implementation of innovation labs and knowledge-sharing platforms","Technologies":"IoT devices, AI and machine learning, blockchain, knowledge management systems","People":"Technology experts, supply chain professionals, innovation teams","Owner":"Supply chain leadership, technology departments"}]}
